website_summaries.verdict: Impressive sound and innovative multi-directional use make this a good option for small spaces.
pros: Can be placed vertically or horizontally, surprising 14W of power
portable and loud enough to travel well
Large Bluetooth range permits use from other rooms
Angled speakers transmit sound in two directions
cons: Users in loud areas might find this speaker too quiet

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sounding speaker but it doesn't last. They replaced my first one that lasted a week but the second one only lasted one year with limited use. I do NOT recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C. Moderie

customer_reviews.title: Risky purchase; roll of the dice if you buy this.
customer_reviews.text: The sound was great...for two days. Then the Bluetooth started malfunctioning causing music to crackle and skip terribly. It happened with every device we connected. Contacted the vendor and they said it needed a firmware update. Tried that but it didn’t work. Contacted vendor again and that was 5 days ago. They have not responded back. Terrible service so far. So if you get lucky and get one that works then it sounds great. If you are counting on timely customer service and have an issue with your speaker then it seems you’re out of luck. I’m very disappointed because I can’t afford to replace it so I’m out $50. Thanks for that.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A Markham

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sound ... buy two the first time, and save yourself the wait for your second speaker!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this product, I use it for my home stereo system ... two speakers and an iPhone are all I need!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Braithwaite

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Sound, Volume Randomly Goes to Max, Non-Existent Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: The sound is pretty terrible. I have an Anker Soundcore2 that puts this to shame. Sound quality aside, the volume randomly goes to max which is ... unsettling. I've updated the firmware, but it didn't help. I reached out to Cambridge SoundWorks for support over a week ago (as of this writing) and have not gotten a response. So, combine the terrible sound quality with buggy operation and non-existent customer service and you've got one very unhappy customer. I won't be buying anything from Cambridge SoundWorks ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Thogar

customer_reviews.title: Major flaw with WiFi interference.
customer_reviews.text: It is not clearly stated that wifi networks interfere with the speaker. If you are using a wireless network to stream audio to a paired device, say streaming Spotifty to your iPhone on your home wifi, the audio begins breaking up. I feel like this is a pretty basic function for a Bluetooth speaker, and I only discovered that this is an issue by visiting their troubleshooting page. The companies recommendation is to disconnect the paired device from wifi, meaning no streaming music. Unfortunately, I discovered this after the window for returns had expired.
customer_reviews.author: kirk snow

customer_reviews.title: Worked for two weeks, then died permanently
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for two whole weeks. Then it died. It will not charge, cannot be turned on. It's completely dead. I'm very disappointed because I bought it to take back with me to Senegal, West Africa where I'm serving in the Peace Corps. And to have it quit on me in a country where I can't return it for a refund or replacement because Amazon doesn't do business in/with Africa. So basically I've just spent the little stipend I get as a volunteer, on a bluetooth speaker that now serves as a fancy paperweight. Very upsetting.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Sniffles-n-Sneezes

customer_reviews.title: Bass really rattly right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the positive reviews I should have focus more on the negative ones. Right out of the box there was a rattle in the speaker and the bass distorted like it's a little am speaker. I read how it had enough volume to fill up a room not true. It is loud enough to be a very low volume in a car or very low background volume on your patio but definitely not allowed speaker at all. I bought a little cheap Ryobi Bluetooth speaker and it kills this and it's only supposed to be a jobsite radio. I definitely would look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: edmocon

customer_reviews.title: I have the oontz angle 3 plus and loved it so I bought the ultra for a Christmas ...
customer_reviews.text: I have the oontz angle 3 plus and loved it so I bought the ultra for a Christmas present thinking it would be even better as it's more watts, but I compared them side by side paired to the same phone and I can't tell that the ultra is any louder and for me the sound is less clear. I liked the plus better
customer_reviews.author: Missouri Gal

customer_reviews.title: How do they make something so small sound so loud and so good?
customer_reviews.text: It sounds amazingly good for it's small size. The bass is so powerful that I've had the speaker move itself when playing bass-heavy music. Subjectively, the bass sounds better than when I plug my phone or computer into a $500 bass guitar amp - that seems impossible but it's true. For a real treat, place it in some kind of corner, e.g., on a window sill, or on a table that's against a wall. You'll get even more volume and more bass.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Freides

customer_reviews.title: Great price but disappointing sound quality
customer_reviews.text: disappointing sound reproduction especially at mid and high ranges. Spoken word reproduction is somewhat poor, especially when played at a higher volume. I guess I should not be disappointed considering the very low price. So for value, I rate it very high. For quality of sound, I rate it pretty low. Another case of getting what you pay for. I should have spent more in order to get the sound quality that I desired ... Bose, Sonos, or even the larger Oontz unit is what I should have purchased. But if small size, quality build, and a competitive and fair price is what you are looking for, I think most people will be quite satisfied with this unit..
customer_reviews.author: Homer Simpson

customer_reviews.title: The advertised 'RICH FULL BASS' is just fiction ...
customer_reviews.text: The truth, all you get is an artificial and distorted bass ... I bought two, but I consider them un-listenable. Both sound like a badly-blown speaker if the bass goes below, say, YoYo-Ma and his cello (and even his classic Bach work causes these speakers to boom and buzz). I mean really, I tried to listen to a classic soul album (Percy Sledge), a classic rock album (Yes), and even Beethoven's 5th. Above a low volume the sound was terrible, due to the ridiculously bad bass. I put both my OontZ Angle 3 Ultra speakers (paired) in my 5-year-old daughter's bedroom. They work for kiddie songs at low to medium volume.
customer_reviews.author: phreejax

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Update: It’s funny I was bragging these things up last week and actually bought another one for someone. Now not only did this one stopped working but so did the early model one I have( bought 4 and 3 are still working). Only had this one 3 months. Love this thing! Sounds great and perfect for the backyard. I would buy again and probably will.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Nissen

customer_reviews.title: Charging Port Terrible and now Dead
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these OontZ Angle 3 Ultras in June 2018. From day one I had problems getting the charging port to connect properly. It was always loose and if I touched the wire even gently the charging wire would fall out of the device. This occurred with both speakers. As of today one speaker is completely dead and will not charge using any type of connector and the other one is failing with the charging cord getting looser and looser. When they worked the sound was great but the quality control is terrible. Not recommended. Now I'm looking for another wireless speaker that will work with my Echo Dot.
customer_reviews.author: J. Reed

customer_reviews.title: major disappointment
customer_reviews.text: As an owner of the original oontz Bluetooth speaker, I was excited to hear the newest version. I still use the original Oontz from years ago but the charge cords are getting hard to find. So, I decided to "upgrade". The sound quality of the angle Ulta 3 is no where near that of the original Oontz. Perhaps I received a flawed product, a lemon? The bass is no where near as clean, the vocals get lost in what it attempts to make a bass note out of. Not sure what to think aside from.... it's sure not an sound quality improvement over the 7 to 8 year old original Oontz.
customer_reviews.author: Berto R

customer_reviews.title: Short life...
customer_reviews.text: After my Oontz Angle died an early death (less than 18 months) I ordered the Angle 3 because I was reasonably pleased with my first Oontz. After less than 8 month of use, the speaker is no longer able to pair with either my Echo Dot, or my MacBook. I've followed all online solutions, including resetting all devices to include the Oontz, the Echo Dot, my Mac and my brain. It just won't hook up. Good sound, if a little bass heavy. I'd expect electronics to last a bit longer these days. I sent two e-mails to customer service and never received a response. My last Oontz purchase for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Big G

customer_reviews.title: Just received speaker and it sounds good but something is broke inside the speaker
customer_reviews.text: Just received speaker and it sounds good but something is broke inside the speaker. It rattles around, i need to contact seller. I will update review later.
customer_reviews.author: md

customer_reviews.title: Replaced and still broke within weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a friend recommended it to me. Once we got it working having to have it replaced as the first one did not work at all. But once it did it would have fit my needs completely. Sound quality is great. However, after the 3rd charging (aka 3rd use) the 2nd one died. The port for the charger is a tight fit at first but gets loser over the week then eventually the plug won’t stay attached. Even if I hold it in place to force the connection to charge it dies to quickly. It won’t charge now and is just a paper weight. Disappointed is the least of it!
customer_reviews.author: Darc

customer_reviews.title: Definite sound lag on bluetooth but great plugged in.
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is just ok but buzzes on bass notes occasionally in some songs. There is a definite sound lag. (Speaker audio slightly out of sync with the video) Noticeable with watching any kind of video. Great for listening to most music or speaking audio when not watching the video. I can move it from room to room as I move about and not have to carry my laptop with me. UPDATE: Plugged directly into my laptop via the enclosed cable and there was no sound lag and the sound was noticably better. No bass buzz and better quality than my laptop speaker. Raising from 3 to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: David Cade

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like crap
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to replace my malfunctioning JBL Flip 4. This speaker does not produce anywhere near the sound quality of the JBL. I also ordered a Bose Micro as an alternative. The Bose Micro is more expensive, but when you hear the two play side-by-side, there is a night-and-day difference. That sound test was the justification for the extra cost of the Bose. It gets louder, better base, more compact, and superior sound. The Oontz Angle is a decent speaker for kids or for something cheap. You get what you pay for in this speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice balanced sound.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit as a replacement for my JBL Charge. One too many drops put the JBL out of commission. When I saw the OontZ was made by Cambridge Soundworks, I remember there was a stereo speaker company by that name. I was not disappointed when it arrived. It sounds great. Turns out Creative Labs purchased Cambridge Soundworks. I'm glad to see they didn't drop the quality. According to the manual, 2 speakers can be put together for true stereo sound. I'm thinking about purchasing another speaker to try the stereo separation. Only problem I purchased the black one for $41. Now the black one is selling for $110.00 used.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy one! Buy TWO!
customer_reviews.text: Wow was I impressed by the sound quality these little speakers can put out. There are a lot of speakers out on the market but these stand separate for the price. Right off the bat I bought two and the pairing capability is easy the first time and then will automatically connect to each other every time they are both on. They can operate as Left and Right for a surround sound quality or both in sync. Great for outdoors, indoors, or separate rooms. Decently loud, great quality, a long battery life, and a low price! Totally worth the buy
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Superior Quality at an Affordable Price
customer_reviews.text: Cambridge Soundworks makes AWESOME speakers and offers them at a reasonable price. I have been using their products for over 20 years and have never been disappointed. So when I saw these Oontz BT speakers were available, and read the review by "Goldie", I bought one to pair with one of my Echo Dots. You simply have to hear it to believe how good it is. Being a Cambridge Soundworks product, I look forward to many years of superior performance from it. I have some Cambridge PC speaker that are 20+ years old and still put out great sound. They know what they're doing, and what the word "quality" means.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use; great sound; great price
customer_reviews.text: I love this little speaker. When I’m moving from room to room I just tuck it under my arm. I can’t think of anything negative to say, except please don’t recommend in your instruction book that it’s ok to stand it on its end. I did that and it would walk off the table and fall to the ground. I finally had to buy another one because of that. Stand it on it’s side on it’s rubber feet, and it stays secure. That’s my only suggestion. Otherwise, I just love this little speaker and I use it all the time. Thank you for such a great product.
customer_reviews.author: jc

customer_reviews.title: Good bluetooth reception, great sound.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the $39 that I paid. Sounds a bit better (and it's much less expensive) than my original Jambox. A nice step up from my older, smaller OontZ Angle, which couldn't quite fill a room without distortion when the volume was cranked up. Sound is pleasantly balanced, so it doesn't have that awful boomy bass that some speaker manufacturers seem to favor. No distortion, even at maximum volume. (Class-D amplifiers are a miracle!) Bluetooth reception is solid. I can start music, then wander around the house and garage while the Bluetooth connection remains perfect the entire time. I'd definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Stearns

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after reading reviews and comments. It was so easy to pair with my phone. We wanted a speaker to take to the outside area where we meet another couple just to be outside and social distance. It seemlessly connected to my iPhone and my Spotify account. The sound is awseome and I actually had to turn it down a little because it was loud when cranked up to max. So far all I can say is that we are very glad we made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware! 90 day warranty insufficient
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware! Works great until it doesnt! Mfrs 90 day warranty insufficient, read all the reviews where this speaker just suddenly stops working. Purchased july 2018, died feb 2019. This speaker never left home, never dropped or abused. Sound cut out in thr middle of a song and never came back. Have tried all of mfrs suggestions - off/on, reset Bluetooth, charged fully. Wont even play sound through aux cable. Bluetooth is working as evidenced by control seen between the speaker and my phone, i just cant play sound. A protection plan is a must with this device. On the other hand, no problems at all with my anker soundcore and i haul it everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Great value and looking for improvements in next gen.
customer_reviews.text: You are most likely here for an inexpensive bluetooth speaker. You're in the right place because this offers everything you could want in this price range. The water resistance and headphone jack is a great touch; battery life is very good; bluetooth connectivity is great; physical buttons are responsive. The only nitpick is the sound quality: the bass is a bit too much (par for the course in this price range), and mids are kind of muddy. There are also some build quality issues where some plastic bits have chipped off, but it doesn't affect the listening experience. Overall a great value with good battery life, portability, and water resistance. Casual listening anywhere you want.
customer_reviews.author: Benson

customer_reviews.title: I returned these bought Ankers
customer_reviews.text: I bought the $35 ones which an be extended and has a few extra button. I was not satisfied overall with the sound quality as it was a little heavy and did not have originality in it. I was confused weather to return or not. Finally returned and puchased Anchors. I am fully satisfied with Anker sound quality which can enjoy for long duration of time. This one did have longer bluetooth range, but connectivity of Ankers is superior.
customer_reviews.author: H Khan

customer_reviews.title: I love this system
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the original Oontz and used it for years. I needed to purchase another Bluetooth speaker and went back to Oontz products. Based on the price, quality, and ease of use. I purchased this unit. After a few months, I had some charging issues. I contacted customer service via email and received a response in minutes, I was very surprised. They worked with me to help resolve the issue. Great product and excellent customer service. This is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: GRB Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Very Fragile - Lasted Less than two months
customer_reviews.text: Sent the following to Cambridge Soundworks seller two days ago NO RESPONSE: "Very Fragile - Lasted Less than two months, a few weeks past the Amazon return window. Sound quality has gone to hell. The unit has not been dropped. In my briefcase, the Oontz is in a case. Used principally for listening to books. Perhaps used for music once Sounds like a ‘blown’ speaker. I purchased the Oontz because of the past reputation of Cambridge Soundworks. More fool me " The Oontz was to replace a Anker SoundCore Sport XL Outdoor Portable Bluetooth Speaker. The Soundcore lasted almost three years, and was treated far less gently. I repllaced the SoundCore, because the SoundCore abruptly failed to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Hine

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value for the quality of this speaker.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this speaker a few days ago and it far surpasses every other speaker by every measure. The sound quality is great, connecting and controlling it is the easiest ever and I immediately ordered a second one to use for a stereo setup. So far I’m very impressed especially considering the price. Additional info: Bought a second one and they work great together. The stereo separation makes a huge difference! Also, discovered that when placed vertically they tend to “walk” from the bass vibrations as the marble shelf in my shower has a slight slant. It fell off into the shower twice, got wet and had a hard drop about 4 feet. No damage and still works fine!
customer_reviews.author: C. Lehmann

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing sound.
customer_reviews.text: The last bluetooth speaker I owned was a Jam X2. It broke 2 years ago and I finally decided to start looking for another one. I chose Anker because I liked their other products and this one had good reviews. The warm fuzzies ended as soon as I started playing music on it. At anything other than low volume it just does not sound good at all. The issue is that as you turn the volume up, the mid-range sound stage becomes very muddied and sounds super compressed. I believe it's probably due to poor engineering, and the passive sub driver is causing serious harmonic distortion with the rest of the range. This speaker is going back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mark F

customer_reviews.title: Mid-quality speaker at budget price
customer_reviews.text: First off, shoutout to Goldie (top Amazon review) for the in-depth and thorough review. It helped me make the purchase. I'll just add that I've used the Angle 3 before, and this Ultra is basically more comparable to more mid-quality speakers like the JBL Flip 4 & 5. This speaker does not sound like a budget speaker at all. It looks, feels, and sounds like it should be closer to the $50-100 range. (Now, don't get any ideas, Oontz!) This speaker edged out the JBL Flip for me because it's in the same quality range with a significant price difference. You can get a higher quality speaker, but for the *value*, this speaker is a winner by a longshot.
customer_reviews.author: Kern

customer_reviews.title: No good for room speakers
customer_reviews.text: After seeing all the glowing reviews (for room speakers), I bought one myself. I must say I am not satisfied with the sound quality. It is tinny and a little muffled sounding, the kind of sound we buy an external speaker to avoid in the first place. I wondered whether my expectation was too high, so I dug out another set of speakers I bought for $40, and my old ones definitely had better fidelity. I tested the Oontz via both bluetooth and audio jack. Perhaps this speaker is tuned for high volume outdoor use, sacrificing fidelity. But if you are considering it for indoor use, I would say look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Good speaker for the price
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for an inexpensive Bluetooth speaker to work with the echo flex primarily. And also to use when we're out in the RV. The speaker was very easy to pair up and sound quality was surprisingly good for a speaker at this price point. Base is fine (I don't crank these up to high volume) and the mid range and highs are pleasent enough. I've only had it for about a week and have had it plugged into the flex so battery life is unknown to me. Hopefully this unit will last a while. I am actually considering purchasing another for the stereo feature.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey B

customer_reviews.title: I can't imagine a better portable speaker at this price
customer_reviews.text: I have to agree with the thousands of people who've given this speaker a thumbs up. I bought it for my Dell laptop running Windows 10 and setup could hardly be easier. All you need to remember is to press the power button for several seconds. I mean REALLY press it! The audio quality is very good for a speaker this size; the bass is amazingly powerful. I use the speaker largely to listen to music, mostly jazz and pop standards of the first half of the 20th Century, so reproduction has to be especially good to compensate for the dated monaural sound. I'm very pleased with what I hear.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Warriner

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a UE Boom with this speaker and was not disappointed The first thing I noticed was the thoughtful layout with the cord sockets on the side and the rubber feet to pick the speaker vents up off the table. The Bluetooth setup was extremely simple on my Windows 10 laptop. And the sounds is absolutely excellent for such a small and inexpensive speaker. Music is vibrant, punchy and clear. Baseball broadcasts are clean and not too bass-loaded. I highly recommend this speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Don't recommend for damp environments!
customer_reviews.text: 10 month review. Pros: great sound, battery life,stereo separation, Bluetooth range. However, the speakers are marketed as splash-proof, which is not really the truth. After 10 months of dry use. One exposure to splashing, both speakers failed (purchased 2). Upon disassembly 24 hours after fresh water moisture exposure, the circuit boards showed extreme corrosion. I was surprised as they were well cared for. Quite a bit of moisture wicked into the electronics area. Subtracted 2 stars for inaccurate description which resulted in failure of both speakers. A costly situation based on trusting the manufacturer's claim. Keep 'em totally dry or you too will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sik of Amzn Revws

customer_reviews.title: Finally, stereo and good bass and good sound.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for stereo. I use them mainly in the bathroom and on patio. Easy to pair up, and once paired shutting off one turns off the other. First bluetooth speakers I have had with good bass. They will buzz a bit on high bass and max sound. The sound quality varies with device you are playing music from. Most devices let you adjust sound so no issue. The speakers will 'walk' across hard surfaces due to bass thumping away. I place them on those lid opener grips and it keeps them in place. Overall I really like them and love the bass.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a year, maybe longer now. It works every time, it heavy so it can sit at an angle without falling, and is water resistant. It syncs easily and has a wonderful, big, sound. I use it outside all the time. The button controls work great as well, no issues there. They are rubberized so I can use them and not worry about them breaking or getting dirty. Much easier to use than Siri or taking my gardening gloves off to manipulate my iPhone. I'm very happy with this purchase. I don't have two of these to test the stereo pairing feature.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyTables

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, just a nuanced distinction between the two
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the Angle 3 plus, this one seems to easier/simpler to sync to my devices over Bluetooth. Also has lower latency after firmware upgrade. However, a primary use case for me is listening to podcasts in the shower, and the ultra seems a but more muffled than the plus. Might sound 'richer' with music, but has lower intelligibility for voice content. Not bad, just a nuanced distinction between the two.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for short warranty and charging failure - great otherwise
customer_reviews.text: Recharge failure at 93 days (3 days beyond warranty) ... excellent performance otherwise ... search turned up LOTS of similar/same issue - poor engineering of this central physical component - I'm sure Cambridge SoundWorks has some really great electrical, electronic, and computer engineers in addition to coders, marketers, and the like - they seem to have the Maxwellian basis down, just need to bring on at least one good structural, mechanical, or other engineer that can help them out with Newtonian mechanics - coursework they apparently skipped or slept through (and clearly failed miserably) ... Take Home Message: USB only charge is a failure ... oh, and past warranty query = no QSW response
customer_reviews.author: tsgrue

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very well made sound quality is awesome battery life not sure as of yet. I only use it during the first 4hours of work and so far I only used it once. It played through without a recharge. So far so good and only took about 25 to 30 minutes to recharge when I got home. The price worth it $51. Including the tax and delivery about the same of what Walmart or target charges for something of less quality. Very satisfied would recommend the OontZ to anyone looking for a decent bluetooth speaker. I use mine on a forklift in a very nosey warehouse very happy.
customer_reviews.author: mark cardola

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient, makes a great speakerphone.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this product for a while and use it for music while doing work around the house. For the price, the sound quality is really good, and the portability is great. I'm working from home now (because COVID) and I do a lot of call in virtual meetings. Using this as a speakerphone has been great. None of my co-workers have complained about call quality. I keep it plugged in to a USB port so it stays charged and keep it connected to my phone all day. Some days I spend 4 - 5 hours on the phone and being able to use this as a speakerphone really makes it bearable.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Not so ULTRA
customer_reviews.text: Sounds good, slight buzzing noise when your music has a lot of bass. Also, doesn't syc voice and mouth movement when watching movies/videos, like watching a bad Kung Fu movie. I bought the 3 Plus and it did a better job syc the voice to mouth movement on the videos. So if you're just listening to music it's worth the extra cost but if you're using it to watch movies/videos you won't like it, buy the 3 plus instead.
customer_reviews.author: 2hawk feathers

customer_reviews.title: Good, loud sound
customer_reviews.text: This was a breeze to connect to my iPad. Now I can FaceTime with much better sound, even when I am walking around. I can set up my iPad to play a movie or a TV show while I am relaxing in my new soaking tub and get great sound from this speaker to accompany it. I can take the speaker into the shower with me and listen to the news or music while I bathe. I can set it up and watch a movie on iPad with a friend (while socially distancing, of course) and we both can hear everything. I really like this speaker. It is a REAL bargain!
customer_reviews.author: Babs

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value! Great sound! A+ battery life
customer_reviews.text: This speaker is amazing! I had the smaller one and was pretty happy with it. When I gave it to my daughter to borrow, I saw this upgraded version and decided to buy it after reading the reviews. I am SO happy I did. The sound quality is a bit better and the battery life is awesome! It's definitely comparable to the smaller JBL speakers. For the price, I couldn't be happier! I'm likely to buy this again as a gift or just to have another since they pair together. I'll update of I choose to do that! You won't regret buying this one! PS... Super happy with the battery life!
customer_reviews.author: Melodia

customer_reviews.title: Poor USB connection to Motherboard Ruins an Otherwise Outstanding Speaker and Bluetooth Device
customer_reviews.text: This was the best speaker and one of the best electronics devices I have owned but the power connection is weak and after buying a new USB cord, wrestling with positioning the replacement cord at quirky angles (and with shipping tape!) I've given up on powering it. It's a shame because the sound is excellent and I love using it with my phone. I wrote to Cambridge Soundworks this morning (it's out of warranty) and if the repair cost isn't too high I'll send it for repair. I'm very upset because I love this little gadget and have become so dependent on it. Grrrr!
customer_reviews.author: EVillager

customer_reviews.title: A must buy!
customer_reviews.text: This speaker is AMAZING. Great sound and is easy to connect. The only issue I have with this speaker is when my phone and my wife's phone has the blue tooth turned on. It defaults to her phone more often so I have to turn off the Bluetooth on her phone in order to connect mine to the speaker. This honestly is the only very small hiccup we run into. We love the portability of it, the bass is very good, and it works from quite a long distance away from a connected device. I highly recommend this speaker if you are looking for fantastic sound quality matched with waterproofing!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel W

customer_reviews.title: For the cost, a well made, well-featured speaker
customer_reviews.text: Aux and micro USB cords included, quality packaging with good docs. I was hoping to replace a much more expensive speaker at my office (rhymes with rose) with a low priced alternative so I wouldn't have to worry about a $200 speaker disappearing. Based on the reviews I expected a little clearer mid range even though I knew it would not offer the overall sonic quality and especially not the full rich bass. Honestly this is a really good $35 speaker, but in my case, it will be relegated to the garage and the search goes on.
customer_reviews.author: elroy

customer_reviews.title: Superior Sound
customer_reviews.text: Very impressive! I ordered my son one for his bday last year and it sounds like he's listening to an old school stero system that costed $500 Like my old one did. I've never heard a blue tooth speaker sound anywhere near as good as this one does. Mine cost me almost $100 and plays half as loud and dosent have the bass quality as this one does. Also, you can hook 2 of them up to the same blue tooth device at the same time and they sync perfectly, so I ordered him another for his bday this year, not like it's necessary but what the heck. The only speaker I'd spend my money on!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole P

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Loved my original angle, but this one pales in comparison. Sounded fine for about a month, then the volume started having issues where it went up and down. After a year the battery only lasts 3-4 hours max. The bass also rattled so bad it’s unlistenable at higher volumes. Used to be a big fan but I’ll probably looks elsewhere in the future.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeFriends

customer_reviews.title: It Randomly shut down. Poor Bluetooth connection, Charge port fell apart after a few weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Sounded ok. After a month or so the charge port had completely fallen apart. I could understand this happening to a smartphone or something else that gets charged daily for a couple of years but not something that I had charged less than a dozen times. The battery held up alright but it would occasionally disconnect and power down and it would take a minute to get the Bluetooth connection going again. Not a bad choice if you plan on using it for a couple of days and trashing it afterwards. I wouldn't depend on this if you're looking for a device to use long-term
customer_reviews.author: Chris Def

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: My one complaint, I suppose, is that from a phone, the only way to unpair seems to be by turning off the phone's Bluetooth connection. But perhaps that is an Android complaint... The speaker comes with no charger, and the indicator flashes while charging, but lights continuously when charged. As it is red, that is not the most intuitive approach I could imagine, but that's a minor issue. My wife uses this with her phone, and is very pleased with the sound when she uses it in the kitchen while cooking.
customer_reviews.author: William Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Sound
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter for Christmas. It is perfect for her to listen to music in her room, and is much better sound than her existing in the ear buds. So far, so good. Battery life is reasonable, connectivity with her iPhone 8 is easy, and it sounds good with bass, mid-range and highs. Very happy with it. This model allows you to connect two of these units as a left and right speaker, if you like, but one was enough. Have not tested the water resistance of the item - it is being used in doors, and not exposed to water.
customer_reviews.author: P. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great little speaker...Certainly "Splash-proof" and more
customer_reviews.text: This isn't the most powerful portable speaker out there, but it certainly is sufficient for me. Why am I suddenly writing a review after purchasing this many months ago? Because the funniest thing happened. I was out on a boat, having a cocktail lol, and I was holding the speaker near my ear to hear. We hit a huge wave and the speaker went flying. I said, "Well, that's gone haha"...until someone spotted it floating across the lake. It was still playing music while floating. I let it dry out, charged it back up, and we've been back in business! Anything that durable gets 5 stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: MelissaW

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but out of sync with videos
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Sound quality Good sound and lots of clean base. Also like the right/left channel stereo when pairing two speakers. Cons: Sound delay There is a 1-2 second delay, which causes lip sync issues when watching videos. Conclusion: Great sound isn't so great if it's not synchronized with the images being viewed. And the firmware update they say will fix the issue, doesn't fix anything. If I was using these only for listening to music, these would be awesome. But, seeing I primarily needed them for watching movies, I returned them and purchased the Tribit StormBox bluetooth speakers. They have the same pair-two feature without the delay.
customer_reviews.author: Naaman Geist

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I love this speaker. I use it mostly for frisbee golfing, however the bluetooth range is HUGE. (Legit 75-125 feet!) Battery life lasts forever! (Like 16+ hours!) I can use this in the garage, and run inside to grab a drink, and my phone is still connected. Lasts multiple days and more while working on my car, or many times out frisbee golfing. Taken off stars because the bass is a little lackluster depending on how its used. Needs about 20% more bass IMO. The audio quality otherwise is on point. 1 more thing to harp on... The volume level is on the speaker, and my iPhone also controls its own volume. (Meaning 2 levels of volume control)
customer_reviews.author: Tyler K.

customer_reviews.title: Get 2 of them
customer_reviews.text: Being able to pair two speakers together is the greatest invention and makes these well worth it. After all, getting two of these is cheaper than most other higher end speakers. The charge lasts forever, and the only downfall is it takes roughly 7 hours to recharge from dead. Other than that, they are awesome. Sound is good with nice bass and the range is easily 100 feet. My last speaker had about 25 feet and if my phone was in my pocket I couldn’t leave the general area without it dropping the signal. I can roam my entire house and backyard with no issues. Again, get 2 or you will regret it.
customer_reviews.author: TPM

customer_reviews.title: Not made well and they go missing when it breaks. Bad experience.
customer_reviews.text: Connect port is loose, contacted the extended warrantÿ Assurion and they referred me back to Oontz. Oontz isn't answering my emails to them. Based on both I will never purchase another item from them and will absolutely NEVER purchase an extended warranty. I'm stuck with a $40 paperweight. Don't buy either, neither stands behind their product, oh yeah Amazon referred me to Oontz when I asked for their help. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Benedetta Enander

customer_reviews.title: Sound Volume dropped after 3 uses.
customer_reviews.text: Product seams to be built well. Solid, good feel and weight. It Bluetooth connects and battery life is good. The radio in my automobile only works at times. So i purchased this to Bluetooth the music from my phone and to use for hands free phone conversations. I was very happy until, After the 4th use i notice volume started decreasing. Now my Moto G7 Phone speaker is louder then this unit. It also now has more bass and less treble and mid tones, with no way to adjust it back to the levels it had when first started using. It has never been used in a humid wet environment or dropped.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Update: The charging port is defective and Amazon customer care cannot help me since I'm outside of the return window. I contacted Asurion because I bought the insurance.. They told me to contact Amazon. So, now I have this cool paperweight that makes me angry to look at. Previous Review: I bought this because my father says it's ridiculous to have 3 box fans plugged into my bedroom while I sleep for white noise. The BlueTooth doesn't connect when I power on the device automatically, but I don't mind. Anyways, I'm able to listen to a box fan "song" on Apple Music now and sleep very comfortably and nag-free.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: when i first received it i thought it was pretty good for the price, but after a week or so of having it the battery life doesn't last very long and it takes several hours to get a full charge. Im worried that in time the battery will stop charging completely. I don't know what it means when the battery will take more then 8 hours to get a full charge if its a bad battery or what. The sound is ok not great. Not loud enough to listen to while taking a shower. I would probably not purchase this product again, even at the $30 i paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Not For the Audiophile.  Sounds Muddy, weak highs.
customer_reviews.text: Nice appearance, but unfortunately, I've found the sound muddy, little to no highs. Wish it had an app to tailor the sound. Would I buy again? Its significantly less expensive than what popular electronics stores have. (Bst by) Bluetooth is good, battery life is very good, but I don't know why the highs are so poor. I should have returned it, but with Covid19, I forgot to ask for a refund or exchange. Maybe this one is defective. Perhaps if I have a properly balanced audio experience, I would revise my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: opinion guy

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: When you look at the size and price of this speaker it is amazing such sound quality can come from it. I honestly can’t imaging a portable battery powered speaker anywhere sounding any better. I’m loving it. The battery life is excellent. I’ve had it a year now using it about two hours a day. Few products are perfect, but for me this speaker is as close as it can get for the expectations. I also have an Angle 3 and a 3 Plus. Both excellent for their price. But this 3 Ultra is the one you want!
customer_reviews.author: roger

customer_reviews.title: Buy This Speaker... FANTASTIC SOUND AND TRULY EXCELLENT COMPANY
customer_reviews.text: #1 - This is a terrific little speaker with a wonderful, moxy sound - lots of base, clear mid-range & trebels. Expensive sound without the big price tag of competitors. #2 - I needed something clarified and reached out to the company through Amazon. Within about an hour I received a personal reply, complete with a representative's name. We wrote back-and-forth until she was convinced that I was satisfied. I LOVE GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!! #3 - I bought this for my college-age daughter's birthday, a music major and a bit of an audiophile. She gives it two thumbs up, and I am eager to get another for daughter #2 so they can hook them up.
customer_reviews.author: Statgirl

customer_reviews.title: Ok speaker
customer_reviews.text: Only used it two days so far, so not sure about the battery yet, but it connected easy. The sound is ok for the price, but I have bought $20 speakers at a big box store with the same sound quality/features. Not returning only because it was not that expensive, but I could go to a local big box store and get one for a lower price with the same sound (in my opinion only). I have had better/louder sound quality with other speakers for similar or slightly more expensive speakers. This one is good if you do not want it too loud in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Read review
customer_reviews.text: Better to buy the old one, better sound quality (same company) and cheaper. I thought if I buy the new one it will be better but NO. Search for: OontZ Angle 3 (3rd Gen) - Bluetooth Portable Speaker, Louder Volume, Crystal Clear Stereo Sound, Rich Bass, 100 Ft Wireless Range, Microphone, IPX5, Bluetooth Speakers by Cambridge Sound Works (Black)
customer_reviews.author: dima

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Addition to the Home Office
customer_reviews.text: When working from home became a regular thing, I bought a USB mini sound bar that sounded like a transistor radio (showing my age?) .. and not too much less expensive than the Oontz. This, on the other hand, I'm thrilled with!! Super easy to set up and really like the sound quality for the price! Granted, I'm not having any loud parties while working so I haven't jacked up the volume, but it's perfect for what I wanted it for! Haven't had it long so not sure how long the battery lasts, but easy enough to recharge!
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: First impressions: Great sound & build quality for the money. Connected to source device right away, without a problem. Sound is relatively clear, bass is fairly strong, & there's no distortion or rattling. Charging cord is laughably short, but connects tightly & charges quickly (a problem I've had with other speakers in the past). I feel like this is a great bang for your buck speaker - like if I were to spend a lot more money, I'd probably get something a little nicer, but what you get with this speaker, for the money, is a great deal. So far so good, I'll update my review if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Nakmuay

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a good speaker for the price
customer_reviews.text: This this sounds great to me but I know there are a lot of speakers out there that sound better but cost at least 3 or 4 times as much. The battery life is pretty good. Mine did keep disconnecting from phone Bluetooth several times one day, not sure what was going on, hopefully just a glitch. Update after about six months. The speaker still sounds good and works well but I can turn it off and be driving my vehicle with it's bluetooth connected and all of a sudden the oontz will turn on by itself and take control of the bluetooth again. It happens all the time.
customer_reviews.author: remoman

customer_reviews.title: Good little bluetooth speaker
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife because Sonos no longer will play local music files from an iPhone. It sounds good for its size, albeit not even remotely as good as a Sonos. It's also not $200. It puts out good sound levels and the bass isn't bad, given its size. Con: the battery charging connector is a bad choice. It's a micro port similar to an older Android charging port. The problem is, it is very flimsy and the plug is wobbly when plugged in. A different type of plug would have been much better. At least if the charging port breaks, I will only be out $40.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B.

customer_reviews.title: Wish it had more high end sparkle
customer_reviews.text: The Angle 3 Ultra is an improvement over the original Angle 3 in many ways. It's a little bigger and more powerful, and definitely packs more bass. But it's smaller brother definitely has crisper high end response and more balanced response. The Ultra would be perfect if it hadn't muted the high frequency response.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Works great but Bluetooth . . .
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers, BLUETOOTH is just not that great. Connects great, just toooo much lag to watch a movie or to read lips as I have to do. So, Either, USE A CABLE (headphone), then it is fantastic, ZERO LAG and still sounds great! or 2. Relegate to JUST SPORTS, where you honestly don't noice the lag. I have used it for almost two years of college Football, Baseball, and Volleyball. Softball and Baseball is harder when you actually see the anouncer. 3. Do both as I do. Sports no cable, movies = cable.
customer_reviews.author: JR Morris

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best BT speaker of this size.  Just buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent BT water proof speaker that delivers impressive volume if not perfect sound. Maybe my favorite features are the impressive battery life and master/slave pairing option. The first allows extended use between charges. The second allows a pair of these to operate as one unit (with the master speaker handling volume/track controls) with master being the right channel (and slave the left, or a "combined stereo" option where they both reproduce both channels). The combined sound pressure is a lot more than I expected and produces loud, clear sound I can hear on my motorcycle at highway speeds)...28 watts combined. The ultra model probably produces better bass but is considerably larger.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M. Kinnard

customer_reviews.title: Not wow'd, not disappointed either.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, first of all, this is no where near as loud as my DKNight Magic Box. The sound is a little buzzy and not as clear either. While it is reasonably loud, it's not wow factor loud, which is what I was expecting for the wattage. I also do not appreciate that the audio controls do not control the speaker volume. So, you need to turn the volume up on your paired device, and also on the speak to achieve maximum volume. This is silly. I probably wouldn't buy another one but I will keep using this one because I have it.
customer_reviews.author: autumn

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic, convenient phone accessory
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my daughter - a little bit of music for her to carry along where she happens to be. She loves it (she's a teen). The sound quality is really nice, seems to have a decent battery life, and making the bluetooth connection is simple. We had the switch fail on us, and Oontz was beyond amazing with a full warranty replacement. They were super interested in our satisfaction; replacement unit was shipped amazingly quickly. I like the product - and I love the company.
customer_reviews.author: average hubby

customer_reviews.title: Better Than or Equal To The More Expensive Sound Towers
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and invest in the Oontz Angle 3 Ultra instead of one of the "higher end" more pricey portable audio towers: it's properly proportioned in size, it's super light weight and the sound quality is outstanding for such an unassuming little unit. I enjoy listening to everything from the news to more ear-demanding classical music on mine and it's surprisingly responsive while accommodating a respectable wide range of frequencies for its compactness. I was considering the more expensive Ultimate Ears but gave this system a try instead and was pleasantly surprised and remain impressed. Kudos to all the designers at Cambridge SoundWorks!
customer_reviews.author: Darjeeling101

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound, Easy Connection, Portable
customer_reviews.text: The good is in the headline, "Good Sound, Easy Connection, Portable." The bad is a real annoyance and greatly detracts from the utility of this Oontz: Unlike some other similar bluetooth speakers I have, this Oontz does not have automatic shutoff! So if you shut off the source, the Oontz still remains on, until the battery is drained! Odd, because the firmware in this Oontz could incorporate automatic shutoff at close to $0 cost. This seems dumb to omit this necessary feature. If this is important to you, buy one of the other bluetooth portable speakers. I will, next one I buy. Too bad, because this is otherwise an excellent speaker.
customer_reviews.author: D. Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I was excited when I got this speaker, the rubbery trim and feet make it feel very secure. Sound clarity is good. It even has auto shut off (after 30 minutes of non use) which I did not see mentioned in the description or in any of the reviews, an indispensable feature for someone like me who constantly forgets to turn it off manually. The included micro USB charging cable is ~ 24" long. One concern, on some of the videos I watch on the computer there is about a half-second delay on the speaker. Annoying but not a dealbreaker...yet...the jury's still out.
customer_reviews.author: Brounet

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I’m an audiophile. I have high end equipment including B&W 802’s and Magnapans. I never expected these small Oontz Angle 3 Deluxe speakers to sound so good. I was stunned by the mid-range and highs. I don’t expect deep bass from such a small set of drivers, but the bass was enough to enjoy immensely. I’ve connected the two as a stereo pair and being able to move them around so easily makes the listening experience excellent. Great value particularly at their price point. Bravo!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Z

customer_reviews.title: You can pair two!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these speakers to pair and use for outdoor movie nights with small groups of socially distanced friends. I really needed something that would be loud enough for everyone to hear. These worked wonderfully for that. It does have limits on high notes or low rumbling bass (we watched Pirates of Penzance for bad movie night and the extra high notes of the soprano made the speakers crackle). They're also good for dancing around the house by yourself. Dance it out!
customer_reviews.author: Variable Statistic

customer_reviews.title: Good value. Get two for stereo sound
customer_reviews.text: Like. Small size fits on any shelf and portable, good connectivity. Power shuts off automatically after a while with no signal to save battery. Expected more bass sound from other reviews but still good for such small speakers. Good tonal quality for background music in my office room and no distortion. Not enough volume for outdoors. Really good value and probably sound better with two units for the stereo separation and higher volume. Cannot go wrong with Cambridge Soundworks products. I will be buying the second unit.
customer_reviews.author: Harold

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality and battery
customer_reviews.text: This little guy sounds great, no two ways about it. The battery lasts a solid 9+ hours, more than I've ever needed. Great clarity and a surprising amount of bass for such a tiny device. Works equally well for music and audiobooks/radio. The BT doesn't connect to older devices, but that's not a huge deal for me. It means I have one laptop from 2012 that can't use the speaker. Also the microphone on it functions but isn't super clear to whoever you're speaking to. Not a deal breaker because I didn't buy it for that.
customer_reviews.author: thanby

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I had a JBL Charge 3 and a Charge 4. Those are pretty good. Bought this for a fraction of the price and I honestly think I like it better, at least more than the Charge 4. It's smaller, lighter, and the sound quality is just as good. I hate the way the Charge 4 only produces sound from one side, which seemed like a step down from the 3. So, if you're worried that this might be a cheap imitation of better speakers... don't be. I'd recommend buying this over more expensive options.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: After a year, it stopped working....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this speaker after reading all the reviews. I received the speaker and worked great. Good sound and a great gadget to take camping and beach. However, after a year, it suddenly stopped working. I contacted the vendor and they gave me an option, for 9.99 they would ship me a new unit to replace this defective one. I just dont think its fair for me to pay an additional 9.99 for an item that was defective and stopped working after a year..... seems like an unfair policy.. wont be buying or recommending this speaker...
customer_reviews.author: Invictus

customer_reviews.title: Over hyped but still a good piece of gear.
customer_reviews.text: It sounds decent enough. It can get loud. It has a great battery and good range. It is not going to compete with any thing outside of its price range for sound quality and clarity. For a less than $40 price tag it competes well but don't be fooled into thinking this will rival a Bose, Sonos or other high dollar system. At the pool or outdoor event it will be fine. Filling your living room with soul sounding goodness at its highest clarity, it is not. It's everything I've said above and nothing more, even though all the positive reviews will make you think it is.
customer_reviews.author: William A Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound and Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with my purchase. I needed a portable, bluetooth speaker for my work presentations. I read some reviews on-line and in my newspaper that recommended this item. The speaker was shipped lightening fast and with a partial charge! The bluetooth recognized my (ancient) iPod quickly and with no problems. I was able to use the speaker while it was completing its initial full charge (which was pretty fast). The sound was great for such a small speaker! Cambridge SoundWorks also has great customer service. Before my purchase, I had a product question. I emailed their customer service and received a very prompt and professional response! Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Zep_Fan

customer_reviews.title: Economical but cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I received the speaker in a timely manner. I was able to connect to it easily with bluetooth but after using it for a few weeks the speaker sounded distorted and was cracking and popping. It was priced accordingly but not worth ordering if it doesnt work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine69

customer_reviews.title: Was awesome.....UNTIL it quit charging
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I have been able to determine that the issue is actually with the charging cord, not the unit itself. I had absolutely no issues with this speaker until it suddenly wouldn't charge any more after 9 months. I took very good care of it, so there was no reason for it to quit working. This is why I give it a 1 star rating. During the time that it charged and worked properly, this was a fantastic little speaker with really good sound quality and a long battery life. If it continues to work good, you will be be pleased with your purchase, but buy at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Kuester

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last but 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I used it for 2 years on and off then it stopped taking a charge. I tried numerous USB to nothing. So I took the top off and the port where the USB inserts was broken off. I'm not rough on this and have a case for it, I think it just gave out and fell off. Cheaply made maybe?? I will say it was a very good speaker for the most part, just disappointed things don't last.
customer_reviews.author: Orangewasp

customer_reviews.title: 5 months then DONE
customer_reviews.text: I got this speaker about 5 months ago and it is no longer receiving a charge. The USB slot seems very low quality and the USB cord will just fall out of it with minimal effort. To mention something about when it was working... Unfortunately when it started running low on battery it would automatically reduced the volume. It was such a strain to hear it at that point I'd rather it just turn off completely. Next time I will go with a more well known brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Good Bluetooth speaker and overall a good value.
customer_reviews.text: I got 2 of these for use with an Alexa Dot in my bedroom. The sound is powerful and bass amazing for a speaker this small . The construction is sturdy and there is some weight to this small speaker. I use these speakers in "tandem" . That is: 1 speaker is Bluetooth paired to the Alexa Dot and the other Oontz is paired to the first Oontz speaker giving true left/right stereo. The one minor issue is that this 2nd pairing occasionally breaks down (not a battery issue - both have power 100% of time) requiring me to reboot the 2nd Oontz speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Mahon

customer_reviews.title: Good sound. Cheap Build. Soon Junk.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap charging port broke after 6 months. Can't recharge battery Had to throw it away. Customers deserve better. The micro USB mini port costs $1 on Amazon and probably 5 cents in bulk but it is the only "moving part" on this product and very prone to fail. Users should refuse to buy electronic gear which does not have USB C charge ports.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: USER FRIENDLY
customer_reviews.text: I own three other small bluetooth speakers ( Klipsch, Anker) I use in various places in our house and Fl. condo. I was drawn to this one by the reviews and especially the large print white controls. The other ones are difficult to read being black on black, I actually used White Out to highlight the controls on the others. I was surprised at the clarity and volume of this unit and can’t imagine how well it would sound if you added another speaker. I wouldn’t hesitate to purchase again and I think the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas M. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Not a keeper for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this speaker to use with the Echo Show 5. It has good clean sound, but is lacking in bass response almost completely. In contacting the manufacturer, tech support says I have done all I that I can do in setting it up. I returned it and ordered another at the same price, that works like I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Speaker!
customer_reviews.text: This item was recommended from Thingiverse for a Peloton workout bike as the speakers are traditionally rear-mounted. We printed a mount for it and it works exceedingly well. The audio quality is great! Bluetooth connections pair flawlessly. Best of all we charge it every once in awhile but have yet to have it run out of juice when we're working out. Definitely recommended and you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Bigger and Richer Sound and Bass Clear and Distortion Free
customer_reviews.text: I thought the original Oontz Angle bluetooth speaker was excellent, and this Angle 3 ULTRA is so much better. It delivers a bold clean sound that you can really crank up with this model's higher wattage. The tone is amazingly rich for the size of this speaker this model has noticeably richer bass response for such a small speaker. Although they're good, do waste your money on earlier versions. For the relatively few extra dollars, this Oontz 3 ULTRA is the way to go. Also, I turned it on right out of the box and the battery seems to be as long-lasting as earlier models.
customer_reviews.author: Tony B

customer_reviews.title: Great in the beginning, did not last longer than a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 1 1/2 years ago. It quit working and will not hold a charge just after a year. It will not even work when I leave it plugged in and try to connect my phone. It’s disappointing because I bought the original Oontz XL back in 2013 and it is working like a champs still. I love the quality of sound from this unit and my older one. I wish they would stand by their product better but I never heard back from them. If you can find an old one pick it up, but I can’t recommend this one based on my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Love These!! Oontz Rules!! Best version  to date!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had Oontz Bluetooth speakers now for a while. Two of The smaller Curves (which always stunned ppl when I gave them a demonstration), then I saw these. Wow. I’d put their ease of functionality, plus the sound quality against anything including “ higher tier” but especially at this price point. I have a Jawbone and yeah they pack a punch. But this new Angle3Ultra has the dual stereo or separate left and right pairing modes when you have a set of two which just fills the room, with as much volume as you’d need. The other cool features include the long range connectivity and battery life! Keep up the great gear for us audiophiles Oontz! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: DesertFlyer

product_meta.title: OontZ Angle 3 Ultra Portable Bluetooth Speaker, 14 Watts, Bigger Bass, Hi-Quality Sound, 100 Foot Wireless Range, Play Two Speakers Together, IPX6, Bluetooth Speakers by Cambridge SoundWorks (White)
feature_bullets: SUPERIOR SOUND QUALITY WITH RICH FULL BASS - Our digital audio processor pumps up the bass and enhances the clarity of the mids and highs; 14 Watts of power delivers surprisingly loud room filling volume from the dual precision stereo drivers and proprietary bass radiator; distortion free stereo sound even at max volume - Gifts for women - Gifts for men

100 - FOOT BLUETOOTH RANGE - Play up to 100 feet away from your device; our advanced antenna design with Bluetooth 4.2 provides fast connection and incredible wireless Bluetooth range of up to 100 unobstructed feet from your Amazon Echo, Amazon Echo Dot, iPhone, iPad, Mac, Samsung Galaxy, Samsung Note, Smartphone, Computer, Laptop and Tablet. Connects quickly and easily

PLAY YOUR MUSIC TO TWO OONTZ ANGLE 3 ULTRA SPEAKERS - Wirelessly connect two OontZ Angle 3 ULTRA speakers together, one speaker plays left the channel and the other plays the right, for incredible stereo separation. Set each speaker to play full stereo and place the speakers in different areas up to 100 unobstructed feet apart. To play the audio from a video, your TV or device needs to be connected to one of the OontZ Angle 3 ULTRA speakers using the 3.5mm audio cable; Speakers sold separately
WEATHERPROOF SPLASHPROOF RAINPROOF IPX6 - The Perfect Shower speaker - IPX6 certified to resist water spray and splash; cannot withstand being partially or fully submerged

PLAY UP TO 20 HOURS ON A SINGLE CHARGE - Play from morning till night with up to 20 hour playtime; ALK TO SIRI FROM YOUR OONTZ ANGLE 3 ULTRA just press the speaker and talk to Siri when connected over Bluetooth to your iPhone or iPad; COMES WITH LONG 6ft MICRO-USB CHARGING CABLE and a 3.5mm audio cable; Official OontZ Angle 3 ULTRA Carry Case sold separately on Amazon
